observation: I see a sign-up page with language selection modals open on both sides of the screen and a country/region selection form in the center. The main form shows 'Select your residence' with a dropdown that says 'Select' and a 'Next' button below it. There are also language options displayed including English, Français, Español, etc. I need to close these language modals first, then select a country from the dropdown to proceed with the sign-up.
reasoning: As an elderly user, I need to clear these confusing language overlays first before I can properly see and interact with the country selection form. I should close the language modal by tapping the close button.
ux_issues: Language selection modals block the main signup form
Small close button may be hard for elderly users to target accurately

outcome.visual_observation: The language selection modal overlay was successfully closed. The BEFORE image shows a modal with language selection options overlaying the residence selection form, while the AFTER image shows the clean residence selection form without any modal overlay. All form elements (dropdown, Next button, login link) are now clearly visible and accessible.
